ygData.subject: RE: How do I make sewing kits...
ygData.msgSnippet: they use hq bear?  what tailoring skill level? i have one in the bank and i usually make bearhide capes and sell them to monks and casters for about 12pp, but
ygData.messageBody:
they use hq bear? what tailoring skill level?

i have one in the bank and i usually make bearhide capes and sell them to
monks and casters for about 12pp, but a 10 slot pack would be cool

At 11:13 AM 7/23/99 -0400, you wrote:
>From: "Adam Wasserman" <wassermana@...>
>
>Wow, a whole 2-3p? Good luck.
>
>The pelts are EXTREMELY rare. As a tailor who has been searching for those
>pelts, I can say that I don't think I would sell a pack for less than 20p.
>And I know at least a dozen people who would jump at the chance to get one
>that cheap.
>
>In fact, the going rate on my server is 5-10p to make the pack for you if
>you supply the pelt.
>
>When I go around trying to find pelts, I offer 1p for the raw pelt. So far
>I've been able to buy 5. That's after 4 weeks of searching. Every time I
>enter or leaave a zone I auction for them, and soemtimes if I spend a long
>time in a zone I'll auction again. All that, and only 5 pelts have turned
>up. I've also spent a large portion of time killing bears. Not one single HQ
>skin has fallen out of a bear I've attacked.
>
>I pass all my skins on to my friend who is a better tailor than I. After 15
>attempts at backpacks, we've only made 2.
>
>Perhaps you need to rethink how much you are willing to pay.
>
>Graedon
>
>-----Original Message-----
>From: Chris Holko [mailto:cholko@...]
>Sent: Friday, July 23, 1999 6:28 AM
>To: EQ_SMITHS@onelist.com
>Subject: Re: [EQ_SMITHS] How do I make sewing kits...
>
>
>From: Chris Holko <cholko@...>
>
>
>
>R
>> What would be really nice is if the sewing kit made by us improved the
>> chance of a tailor suceeding. Right now after patchwork it is almost
>> impossable to make the other types of leather based armor. It would
>
>
>My problem is that I am more than willing to pay 2-3p for player made
>backpacks, yet I can never find anyone making them!
>
>10 spaces! - with my normal "smithing setup" that gives me 14 more slots
>to dump stuff into!
>
